Manager Response: Congratulations!  Thank you for choosing The Ritz-Carlton, Laguna Niguel for your honeymoon.  We hope we have created very special memories for you in the past and  look forward to creating more for you in the future.  Thank you for your feedback on Trip Advisor. We greatly appreciate it and it gives us the details we need to ensure our service and facilities remain excellent.

Summary Heading: Wonderfull views up and down the coast
Summary: Stayed here for Five days over Thanksgiving after three weeks of touring and being constantly on the move. It was the perfect place to flop and catch our breath. We had an ocean view room on the second floor which wrapped around the corner of the building so we had sun on our balcony from dawn to dusk. Extremely lovely, comfortable room, although I think it must have been at the top end. No problem with a coffee maker (see a previous review. ) We just asked for one, and I asked for, and got, a set of scales. I liked the fact that there were a lot of small areas to eat and drink, which gave it an intimate and friendly feel, and we easily got chatting to other holiday makers. Didn't make use of spa or pool  as our room was too comfortable to leave for long.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing The Ritz-Carlton, Laguna Niguel for your luxury destination to celebrate the holiday.  We enjoyed having you with us.  We take pride in providing the most memorable and relaxing stays for our valuable guests.  Your care and comfort are our highest missions.  We look forward to welcoming you back.

Summary Heading: High end hotel on one of the best spots to view the Pacific I've ever seen
Summary: I had been at this hotel for a conference two weeks earlier and loved the view so much that I had to share it with my wife so we went back for the weekend.  The Ritz has a great bar looking over the ocean, but with a glass of wine and a book sitting in their Adirondack chairs in the afternoon/evening, my wife and I had one of the most relaxing, pleasant times of the year.  The room was lovely, but you expect that with the Ritz.  The staff was great, but I expect that also.  I have stayed at the St. Regis, which I liked but nothing can compare with this view.  The Monarch Beach golf club near there is a very well manicured resort course that also has great views.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful comments and we are thrilled you have found a new home for your travels to Dana Point, CA!

Summary: You can't best this hotel for stunning views and fantastic service and amenities. I did a weekend package and loved (absolutely loved!) the club lounge for breakfast (included in our rate). Very memorable and oh so scenic. Recommend the spa for outstanding treatments. The fitness center is great too.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful comments.  We are looking forward to welcoming you back to your new home away from home!

Summary: stayed at the RCLN with my husband during his business trip.  It was perfect.  The staff was delightful, grounds immpeccable and the service perfection.  Cannot wait to return! Sunsets are too die for.  Location is surpurb.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful comments.  We are delighted you have found a new destination! We look forward to welcoming you back!

Summary: Great view of the ocean and access to the beach.  It is a very large property so it feels a little less intimate.  The service is good, but I have to clean the glue from the valet parking sticker off the car windshield.  Maybe I set my expectation too high because this is a Ritz.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, we greatly appreciate you taking the time to provide a review on Trip Advisor.  Since you are a neighbor of ours, please come join us again soon.  We would be delighted to have the chance to create more meaningful memories for you.

Summary: My wife and I stayed here our wedding night and it was quite a disappointment  as they forgot, they actually forgot the romantic turn down service on my wedding night. Safe to say we thought we would never go back,  I booked a room and mentioned this at the front desk and they redeemed themselves, I did pay a small fee $100 for the room upgrade but they gave me the best room in the house and it was worth every penny. The views  are unmatched (except bora bora)the service was great and we never wanted to leave.  If you want a great little cafe around the corner for breakfast or lunch you must try Pain Du monde, unbelievable get the  ham & cheese croissant,   We will be back for sure, ask for room 1504 if you can get it.
Manager Response: Congratulations to you!  And thank you for choosing The Ritz-Carlton, Laguna Niguel as your luxury destination.  We realize you have many to choose from and we value your loyalty.  Thank you for sharing your experience on Trip Advisor.  We hope to welcome you back very soon, perhaps for your 1st anniversary!  Room 1504 is waiting for you...

Summary Heading: Uncompromising Service; with Hugely Disappointing Rooms
Summary: Excellent location; beautiful grounds but the rooms are way out of date; old;  and unfunctional..........do yourself a favor and DO NOT pay to upgrade!  I ended up paying $895/night for a room that wasn't worth $300/night;   I would not stay again.........too bad because the service was excellent!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were on a romantic get away. The ocean view is amazing ! The hotel felt more like an upgraded Marriott. Beds were comfortable and room clean. Very small balcony, we had to sqeeze by the chairs to get into them .  We did love the lounge over looking the ocean. Good wine list.  Pool area was so-so. We had to search for a lounge chair that didn't have bird droppings. There was NO service at the pool. Food/bev area was boarded up, we found this odd for a Sunday. We were looking forward to the wine/cheese lounge before dinner, this too was closed and we were advised it  is closed on Sun. & Mon......  The dining room atmosphere was mediocre. We had a great ocean view table had we eaten at 5 PM. But, at 7:45 PM it was to dark. I have stayed at beach front hotels were they spotlight
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Classy and Elegant, with Superior Service...
Summary: What a great stay at The Ritz Carlton in Dana Point! The staff was very friendly and courteous, and constantly jumped to help, offer advice, or do whatever was needed to make our stay absolutely perfect. An immediate upgrade upon check-in to an ocean-front room led to a great night of sleep. The sound of the waves crashing against the beach below from open balcony windows was sublime. The secluded beauty of Dana Point mixed with the lush vibrancy of Laguna combine to make this hotel a perfect oasis. This stay will result in several return visits for sure!
Manager Response: Thank you for the rave review!  The sound of the waves crashing is soothing isn't it? We look forward to welcoming you back soon and creating more memories for you.

Summary: A great hotel in a fab location. Ocean views are fantastic.....you can hear the sea! The guys in club...Tina, Kathryn and Mary are the best. Its just like you are coming home when you enter, they make you feel so welcome and cant do enough for you The hotel is stunning, well kept, relaxing and quiet and does credit to Ritz Carlton ....would we come back.......you bet
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the Ritz for a friend's wedding.  Throughout my stay the staff somehow remembered and greeted me by name.  The service was impeccable and the hotel itself it beautiful.  I had a standard room that overlooked the pool.  It was very clean,  spacious and beautifully decorated.  The wedding was breathtaking.  The ceremony was outdoors overlooking the ocean with orchids and crystals dangling from the trees.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a beach holiday.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: If there's only one place in California, this is it.
Summary: From the minute you check in the service at The Ritz is up to par on all levels.  The front desk staff knows you, your family, kids' names, preferences, you name it.  The wait staff at breakfast is amazing with area knowledge and identities of the surfers mesmerizing you while you're sipping your tea.  Relax poolside during the day and catch the sunset from the bar while enjoying the special martinis and warming yourself by the firepits.  Tennis is available with match play or play with the pro.  We're still re-living our fond memories from The Ritz at Laguna Niguel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My adult daughters and I had a great girl's stay at Laguna Niguel.  The service was fantastic and everyone was eager to please. The concierge went out of her way to get us tickets for the Pageant of the Masters which is a great plan performed every summer.  Don't miss it if you are in Laguna in July or August.  The only issue we had with the hotel was that the food was not outstanding.  The menu was limited and the food that we tried was not up to par with a typical Ritz property.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Overall amazing and picturesque location. Ritz staff was very service oriented and many went above and beyond for my husband and I (and to set a frame of reference, we do a lot of high-end luxury travel). The setting cannot be beat. The only complaint was the rooms are slightly dated and kind of on the small side- but when you can leave your patio door open and listen to the waves crash all night you easily overlook that. Would def recommend, and good value with Amex Fine Hotels and Resorts package.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: great hotel, and amazing service on club level
Summary: Just returned from a week at this property with my wife and young child.  the property is amazing, but more spectacular is the service on the club level where we stayed.  unfortunately, both my wife and child got sick during the trip, however the level of service from the club concierge was really "something to write home about".  From getting special meals made and delivered from the kitchen, to going out at night after hours and getting pedialytes for my child, I really was blown away.  It was like having a personal assistant on call 24 x 7.  Mary especially was really super and went so far out of her way to take care of us.     The location is absolutely gorgeous, right on a bluff with amazing views.  Laguna Beach is a 15 minute drive away.  Super walking trail right next to
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for a long weekend to celebrate our anniversary.  I had been to the hotel 10 years previously and remembered the fantastic view of the Pacific and the usual impeccable service of the Ritz Carlton.  I was eager to return with my wife, but was sadly disappointed in many respects. The hotel was not properly staffed resulting in long waits for virtually all services.  In fact, I wondered if it was the same hotel that I had previously enjoyed so much.  For a normal hotel it might have been acceptable, but expectations of the Ritz Carlton are higher.   Long waits for service at the pool, the market and the restaurant became frustrating as an ice tea could take 30-45 minutes to arrive.  Also, the hallways were dirty and the room that we had as well as,
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you are staying anywhere near Laguna, do yourself a favor and stay at the Ritz..  This hotel is truly beautiful, the location, the rooms and  of course the service.  From the minute you walk in you know you are in for a treat.   The sunset patio is probably the most beautiful place to watch the sunset and enjoy some sushi!  Thank you to the staff at the Ritz!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This trip goes back a few years (pre Oct 2009 but that's as far back as the site allowed me to go) and I have always felt guilty re not writing to management re our stay. Besides the fact that the resort was perfect in every way, we had an unusual event in our family and I just want to let everyone know how it was handled by the staff. In the middle of the night, my husband woke up very ill to the point that he said he needed to go to the hospital. (He's not a complainer or hypochondriac so I knew this could be serious). I called the front desk and asked if they could call for a cab as we needed to get to the hospital asap. Before I hung up the phone there was a knock at the door . In the hall was a staff member with a wheelchair for my husband. When we got to the hotel entrance
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beautiful hotel, beautiful views, but horrible service! Everything from the front desk, to the valet parking to the waitstaff and the security. The service people were completely rude to your face and so slow in about every aspect of the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fabulous! Get a beachfront room with a view!
Summary: This Ritz Calton is wonderful and the view from our room was to die for!  We dined in the restaurant for dinner and the steak with black truffle sauce was so fantastic that we went back the next evening! All of our experiences here were great! The spa was really nice and beautiful and the treatments were lovely.  I even took a tennis lessson because the resort has really nice tennis courts.  The pool was nice too.  We had so much fun!  The staff was extremely nice too.  I thought that the rooms seemed like they might need new carpet but that was the only flaw I saw.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: One of a kind location, impeccable rooms, impeccable service
Summary: We just returned from this property and are still starry-eyed.  We've stayed at many a SoCal beachfront resort.  This one is the best yet.  Breathtaking views.  Beautiful rooms that are thoroughly cleaned, not just surface dusted.  Service like I've never experienced at a beach resort.  Every staff member I came across made a genuine effort to get me what I was looking for, and actually succeeded.  Their staff is clearly expected to be smart and is empowered to do what it takes to deliver results.  A first for me at a SoCal beach resort!  I never use a hotel's fitness center when I'm on vacation, but theirs lured me in.  The machines all face a full wall of windows that overlook the ocean beyond the bluff.  That view can be credited to extending 15 minutes to my usual workout.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: miserable room / house keeping experience -- horrible value -- much better options in the immediate area
Summary: It is very clear that Ritz-Laguna has let its room experience slip dramatically.  As a frequent guest at various So Cal coastal hotels, the Ritz is no longer a viable option.  The Montage (among many others within 20 mile of the Ritz) so dramatically surpasses the Ritz, there is no point in a stay at the Ritz.  We recently stayed there (first week of July 2010), in one of the ocean view rooms, so paying approximately $900 nightly, and the experience was shockingly bad.  The room was messy upon arrival, food on the carpet, burned matchsticks around the toilet, broken refrigerator, among other maladies.  Subsequent to the stay, I received a conciliatory phone call from the general manager of house keeping, and we had a nice conversation about the importance of the Ritz brand, etc.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the Ritz for a business meeting and my husband came along. The hotel was beautifully situated, easy to reach from Orange County, with spectacular ocean views. The lobby flowers are the most beautiful I have seen in a hotel! We enjoyed the quiet room at night. We did have poolside access, we were located by the larger pool (not the quiet pool) so that was a bit noisy during the day. The bed was very comfortable. Bathrooms were standard tub/shower, would have expected a walk-in separate shower in a hotel of this caliber but guess that is the "old style". Though the hotel seemed busy, there were ample lounge chairs by the pool (something you don't find in all resorts!) and we did enjoy the quiet pool for a break from the crowd. Like most high-end hotels, you are charged
Manager Response: none

Summary: We live nearby, but decided to stay at this Ritz for a weekend get away.  The club lounge is beautifully decorated with plush sofas and a warm fireplace.  The candy jars are our children's favorites.  The tea selection by  Might Tea Leaf was wonderful, and I was hooked, so now I buy their teas for my house.  The Sunday brunch at this hotel is scrumptious, and  the cheese selection is just magnificent.  The best Sunday brunch in Southern California.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The Great Ladies at The Ritz!
Summary: In August, we made our 5th visit to the Ritz Carlton Laguna Niguel.   Last year, we encountered a problem with one of the 2 rooms we were assigned.   The Director of Guest Services, Clarita Parra, took charge and got us into a decent room on the same floor as the rest of our party.   This year, we were upgraded to the Club Level and I just had to write about the wonderful treatment we received during our stay.    We were celebrating a college graduation on this trip and when we checked into our room, we found a huge balloon bouquet complete with the graduate’s name on the balloons and a card signed by the people on that level - plus Ms Parra!   Although it was late, we went down to the Club Level’s food & beverage area where we were greeted by Penni Garcia.   Penni knew we had
Manager Response: none

Summary: From the moment you step foot in this amazing hotel, everything is perfect !!! The grounds are immaculate and gorgeous. The Staff is amazing and the location is just special !!! It was the most relaxing 3 day visit and I cant wait to go back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 4 nights. It is what is expected at  such a property. The hotel is beatifully decorated, rooms are well appointed in every way. The views of the beach are stunning. They have 2 pools, one being a quiet area zone. The pools do not overlook the ocean (too bad). The shuttle service to and from the beach is convenient as it is a steep incline up to the hotel, so walk or shuttle it depending on your energy level. We had a breakfast package, excellent food and service. Now for the "glitches"  When we arrived and got to our room our fridge didn't work. They had to install a new one but could not put it in the same location as the new one was larger, so they had to put it under the desk area, very awkward but workable. The staff were always courteous I
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything about this hotel is beautiful - the location, set high on a bluff, is outstanding.   The lobby area is refreshed with fresh floral arrangements every day adding to the atmosphere.   The rooms are very well appointed, not overly spacious, but comfortable.  We dined at Raya and thought both the servce and food were exceptional.   It was a little chilly the day we were there but the pool was heated and very comfortable.   The beach is about a 5 minute walk but the hotel offers transportation via a shuttle.   The outdoor bar at sunset is the best place in the entire hotel to be.  Everyone on the staff is friendly and accomodating - our receptionist Courtney was so friendly and greeted us by name when we checked out - we are looking forward to returning soon!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wow...! One of the best hotel/resort in California
Summary: Beautiful location, exceptional environment and excellent service!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: resort fees? five star? not quite.
Summary: First of all, and this is not limited to the Ritz, but I'm so tired of paying resort fees, and particularly in a hotel ilke the laguna niguel. The whole place is A RESORT. Why would we pay an additional fee? for internet? use of the pool? Sorry, but I thought these were priced in already. Basically, this is their method of squeezing every possible dollar out of your pocket, and its too bad a supposedly five star hotel has to resort to such underhanded tactics. I'd rather they bumped up the room rate $25 a day and stopped trying to lead people to believe they are getting a 'deal' other than that, our stay simply was not good. Room wasn't ready till 5.45, even though we checked in at 2!  the other guests were....well..not what you'd expect at a ritz. not being snooty, but the pool

Summary: I stayed in this hotel again last week for probably the 6th time. It only improves with age, as does the near perfect service. The main restaurant, Raya, was full, but they gladly served us a full dinner in the bar. The service and food quality were stellar. I've always thought the hotel was a bit overpriced in comparison to others in the area, but it's definitely top notch. Can't wait to return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton for two nights and found it to be a very special place.  Our ocean view room and balcony provided us with hours of relaxation and great views of the beach and ocean.  The staff could not have been more helpful and the restaurant was outstanding.  We ate breakfast and dinner there and found the service and quality of the dining experience to be exceptional.  We would highly recommend this hotel as a truly outstanding place to relax and get away from it all.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is in bad need of a makeover!  The once beautiful hotel has been badly neglected yet it still charges as if it is a nice property.  The problem is I think they have more $400 a night guests than $800 a night guests, so the place is full of overweight white trash.  Don't waste you money at this hotel.  Go to the local Motel 6 instead for the same experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Love it even after having been here 5 or 6 times! Fabulous...
Summary: I have stayed at this location many times, was here the first two when it was done very tradtiionally and somewhat old world grand. Then they renovated it, and made it very modern but done in a very elegant transitional decor. The hotel is majestic in its setting, better than the Montage, it sits very high on a bluff....and the setting is truly breathtaking!!!! The hotel itself is equally breathtaking and fabulous......and the ONLY thing I would say is a minor issue is the size of the regular rooms. They are small but luxurious, but could be bigger...the suites are generously sized. The views, spa and restaurant are all spectacular. I highly recommend this hotel, the pool is also fabulous and not crazy like many hotels....I also recommend this for a family, we have also stayed
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Typical Ritz Carlton but don't try to eat here!
Summary: This used to be have an old stuffy feel but a recent updating to the lobby common areas has brightened it up.  Service was as expected and commensurate with a Ritz.  Just don't attempt to eat here! Whoever is in charge of the food/menus/crew should be replaced.    This new trend towards overly fancy food with overly expressed descriptions and exotically named ingredients just does not work.  Even the waiter, when we asked it they have any real/regular food admitted that many had our reaction.  If my wife and I are the demographic of who frequents this type of place they should know many of us middle age baby boomers like real, uncomplicated food choices.
